definition: The species either is or was native to the area.
The species either is or was reintroduced through human activity, either on purpose or accidentally. It is implied that the species was originally native at the location.
The species either is or was introduced outside of its historical distribution range through either through direct or indirect human activity.
Synonym of archaeophyte. A subcategory of introduced to acknowledge the importance of modern long distance transport in the introduction of species.
Synonym of neophyte. A subcategory of introduced. An organism introduced from the beginning of the Modern Era.
Synonymous with casual. The species has lived or occurs sporadically at the location but is not considered native.
The speciesâ€™ origin in an area is uncertain (not known). It may be native, reintroduced, introduced, or cryptogenic (a term often but not exclusively used with disease).
